name: Calistoga High School Tennis and Pickleball Courts
description: Come play pickleball at Calistoga High School Tennis and Pickleball Courts in Calistoga, CA! There are 4 outdoor hard courts. The lines are overlaid on a tennis court, so the net is a little taller than a normal pickleball net. The courts are free. Players have access to restrooms and lights.

name: Crane Park
description: Crane Park is one of the most popular places to play pickleball in St. Helena, CA. There are 4 outdoor acrylic courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. Reservations are not available. Amenities include restrooms, water, and lights. The courts are free.

name: Las Flores Community Center
description: Las Flores Community Center is one of the most popular places to play pickleball in Napa, CA. There are 4 outdoor asphalt courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. The courts are free. The facility includes amenities like restrooms.
open_play_schedule: Open play all day. 4 out/ 4 in when 7 or more paddles are in the saddle. Otherwise,  winners stay on and the next 2 players challenge.  Popular open time is 7am-11am then again 5pm until sunset. There are no court lights. No water fountain.  There is a portable toilet nearby. Free parking.

name: Napa Pickleball Club
description: Napa Pickleball Club is one of the most popular places to play pickleball in Napa, CA. There are 4 outdoor hard and wood courts. The lines are permanent, and portable nets are available. The courts are free. The facility includes amenities like lights and restrooms.

name: Napa Valley Country Club
description: Napa Valley Country Club is a place to play pickleball in Napa, CA. There are 4 outdoor hard courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. Reservations are not available. A membership is required to play. Amenities include restrooms and water.

name: Napa Valley Tennis Association
description: Come play pickleball at Napa Valley Tennis Association in Napa, CA! There are 6 outdoor hard courts. The lines are overlaid on a tennis court, so the net is a little taller than a normal pickleball net. A membership is required to play. The facility includes amenities like restrooms and trainers or lessons. Reservations are available.

name: Silverado Country Club and Resort
description: Pickleball courts are open only to Silverado Resort guests and Silverado Country Club Members. The Resort has rental racquets available. Pickleball courts are open year-round during daylight hours, weather permitting. Court reservations can be booked 3 days in advance by calling 707-257-5555.

name: The Crush Pad
description: The Crush Pad is a place to play pickleball in Napa, CA. There are 2 outdoor concrete courts. The lines are permanent, and portable nets are available. A one-time fee is required to play. The facility includes amenities like food, restrooms, water, lights, and wheelchair accessibility. You can reserve the courts.

name: Yountville Community Center
description: Yountville Community Center is a place to play pickleball in Yountville, CA. There are 6 courts. 4 are outdoors and 2 are indoors. The lines are permanent, but you'll need to bring your own net. Amenities include restrooms, water, and lights. A one-time fee is required to play.

name: Yountville Vineyard Park
description: Yountville Vineyard Park is one of the most popular places to play pickleball in Yountville, CA. There are 4 outdoor courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. The facility includes amenities like restrooms. The courts are free.
